name: Cauliflower Hot Wings with Vegan Aioli
description: These vegan cauliflower hot wings are the perfect comfort food. They're so tangy, spicy, and incredibly delicious! It's almost a bit creepy how close they are to the real thing!
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup all-purpose flour ((or chickpea flour for a gluten-free version))
3/4 cup unsweetened almond or soy milk
3/4 cup panko breadcrumbs ((omit for a gluten-free version))

recipeInstructions.text: Carefully cut the cauliflower into bite-sized florets.
recipeInstructions.name: Carefully cut the cauliflower into bite-sized florets.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, the plant-based milk, the water, the garlic power, the paprika powder, the salt, and the black pepper.  Stir until well combined. For a gluten-free version substitute the all-purpose flour with chickpea flour (also omit the water if using chickpea flour).
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, the plant-based milk, the water, the garlic power, the paprika powder, the salt, and the black pepper.  Stir until well combined. For a gluten-free version substitute the all-purpose flour with chickpea flour (also omit the water if using chickpea flour).

recipeInstructions.text: Dip the florets into the batter, so they’re completely coated.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip the florets into the batter, so they’re completely coated.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll them in the panko breadcrumbs. Omit this step for a gluten-free version. However, they’re way crispier with the panko breadcrumb coating.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll them in the panko breadcrumbs. Omit this step for a gluten-free version. However, they’re way crispier with the panko breadcrumb coating.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lay the cauliflower florets on the baking sheet. Don’t put them on top of each other. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 °F.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lay the cauliflower florets on the baking sheet. Don’t put them on top of each other. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the cooked cauliflower wings to a bowl. Combine the BBQ  sauce with a teaspoon sriracha sauce and pour it over the baked cauliflower wings. Evenly coat them from all sides by stirring them a few times.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the cooked cauliflower wings to a bowl. Combine the BBQ  sauce with a teaspoon sriracha sauce and pour it over the baked cauliflower wings. Evenly coat them from all sides by stirring them a few times.

recipeInstructions.text: Put the coated hot wings back on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake again for 20 minutes at 350 °F.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the coated hot wings back on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake again for 20 minutes at 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately and sprinkle with the green onions and serve with vegan aioli or vegan ranch sauce. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately and sprinkle with the green onions and serve with vegan aioli or vegan ranch sauce. Enjoy!

keywords: cauliflower wings, how do you make cauliflower wings, recipe for cauliflower wings
